<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// About Module states: added-&gt;loaded-&gt;finalized.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The purpose of the &quot;added&quot; state is having modules in standby. (added=known</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// but not compiled). The idea is that you can add a module to provide function</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// definitions but if nothing in that module is referenced by a module in which</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a function is executed (note the wording here because it&#39;s not exactly the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ideal case) then the module never gets compiled. This is sort of lazy</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// compilation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The purpose of the &quot;loaded&quot; state (loaded=compiled and required sections</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// copied into local memory but not yet ready for execution) is to have an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// intermediate state wherein clients can remap the addresses of sections, using</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// MCJIT::mapSectionAddress, (in preparation for later copying to a new location</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// or an external process) before relocations and page permissions are applied.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// It might not be obvious at first glance, but the &quot;remote-mcjit&quot; case in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// lli tool does this.  In that case, the intermediate action is taken by the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// RemoteMemoryManager in response to the notifyObjectLoaded function being</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// called.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcjit"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight">MCJIT : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/executionengine/#a92eef8691cfbe4446ee15d34258c3185">ExecutionEngine</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// finalizeObject - ensure the module is fully processed and is usable.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// It is the user-level function for completing the process of making the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// object usable for execution. It should be called after sections within an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// object have been relocated using mapSectionAddress.  When this method is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// called the MCJIT execution engine will reapply relocations for a loaded</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// object.</span></CodeLine>
